Package emaildirectory

Class Directory

java.lang.Object
emaildirectory.Directory
public class Directory
extends java.lang.Object
Class: Directory Purpose: This class acts as the backbone of the driver class. It contains all functions which the user may access through the main menu.
Since:
2020-10-08 Course: CST8130 - Data Structures
Version:
1.0
Author:
Neil Kingdom

  • Constructor Details

    • Directory

      public Directory()
      Empty constructor for creating dummy Directory objects
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • Directory

      public Directory​(int size)
      Constructor for initializing arrayList
      Parameters:
      size - The size of array list
      Since:
      2020-10-08

  • Method Details

    • readListFromFile

      public void readListFromFile​(java.util.Scanner scan, int lineCount)
      Read a properly formatted text file into array list
      Parameters:
      scan - Scanner object passed from driver class. scan should have text file as it's input when passed to this function
      lineCount - An extra precaution in case the file has a trailing line This function reads each item from the specified file and creates EmailList objects appropriately. The function decides how to handle each email which is read, and will call sortByDescending() function.
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • sortByDescending

      public void sortByDescending​(EmailList eList)
      Sort EmailList objects lexicographically
      Parameters:
      eList - The EmailList to be sorted This function handles placing EmailList objects at the beginning or end of the array list depending on their numeric ascii value
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • createList

      public void createList​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Create a new email list
      Parameters:
      scan - Scanner object passed from driver class for user input This function allows the user to create new email list objects. These act as placeholders until actual values are placed in them
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • displayAll

      public void displayAll()
      Displays all emails from all email lists
      Since:
      2020-10-08 This method will display all emails from all email lists which are not empty

    • displayListMail

      public void displayListMail​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Display all emails from a specified list
      Parameters:
      scan - Scanner object passed from driver class for user input This method displays only the emails from a user specified list (assuming it is not empty)
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • addToExisting

      public void addToExisting​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Add a new email to an existing email list
      Parameters:
      scan - Scanner object passed from driver class for user input This method adds a valid user created email (according to EmailAddress class) to a specified email list
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • deleteEmail

      public void deleteEmail​(java.util.Scanner scan)
      Deletes a specified email
      Parameters:
      scan - Scanner object passed from driver class for user input This method will delete an email specified by the user from an existing email list
      Since:
      2020-10-08

    • isEmpty

      public int isEmpty()
      Check if array list is empty or null
      Returns:
      Returns -1 if the array list is null or empty, otherwise returns 0 This method is used to check if the array list has been properly initialized
      Since:
      2020-10-08
